title: Which is correct: I got home or I arriving home? - Quora

response.answer_text: I arrived home I reached home I came home I got home I returned home I went home  As and when you are using simple past tense you have to mention the time. Usually simple past tense is used for the past completed actions whose time limits are mentioned. As such it is used for actions completed in the past at a definite time ⏰. It is used to describe an action which happened or took place in the past time such as yesterday, last night, a week ago,  Structure: Subject + verb2 + article /prep + object. I arrived home at 6 O' clock I came home in the evening. I returned home a week ago. I got home yesterday. I reached home last night itself. No proposition is used before home. I typed your query an hour ago.

You can never say I arriving in any sentence because if you are going to use the progressive (-ing) form of any verb you need the verb to be in front of it. I am arriving home. As to your question, whether you say, “I got home” which feels very incomplete, or “I am arriving home,” that depends on what you are attempting to say. You might say, “I am arriving home” if you are on the phone with someone and it is happening right at that particular moment. “I got home” could answer a question. Did you make it home last night? Yes, I got home.
